member.name: T:NsqSharp.Bus.BusService
member.summary: Static class to start and stop the bus.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.Bus.BusService.Start(NsqSharp.Bus.Configuration.BusConfiguration)
member.summary: Starts the bus service.
member.remarks: Note: This is a blocking call for Console Applications running in interactive mode. This method will block until Ctrl+C is pressed and then initiate a clean shutdown.
member.exception: Thrown when is null.

summary.para: Stops the bus permanently.
Windows Services - This method is called when the service is stopped or restarted. You do not need to call it directly.

ASP.NET Applications (including Web API and WCF) - May call this method directly if clean exit is a high priority. If not called directly it will be called automatically when the hosting enviroment shuts down the application (Application Pool stop/restart, Site stop/restart, etc), although the timeout period before a forced shutdown is not guaranteed.
Console Applications - May call this method directly, otherwise it will be called automatically when the user presses Ctrl+C.
Windows Forms/WPF Applications - May call this method directly if clean exit is necessary, otherwise it will be called with a short timeout (~3s) when the process exits normally (not force killed).

member.name: T:NsqSharp.Message
member.summary: Message is the fundamental data type containing the , , and metadata of a message received from an nsqd instance.

member.name: T:NsqSharp.IMessage
member.summary: Message is the fundamental data type containing the , , and metadata of a message received from an nsqd instance.

summary.para: Disables the automatic response that would normally be sent when returns or throws.
This is useful if you want to batch, buffer, or asynchronously respond to messages.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.IMessage.Finish
member.summary: Sends a FIN command to the nsqd which sent this message, indicating the message processed successfully.

summary.para: Sends a TOUCH command to the nsqd which sent this message, resetting the default message timeout.
The server-default timeout is 60s; see .
If FIN or REQ have already been sent for this message, calling has no effect.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.IMessage.Requeue(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})

summary.para: Sends a REQ command to the nsqd which sent this message, using the supplied delay.
A delay of null will automatically calculate based on the number of attempts and the configured .
Using this method to respond triggers a backoff event.

member.param: The minimum amount of time the message will be requeued.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.IMessage.RequeueWithoutBackoff(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})

summary.para: Sends a REQ command to the nsqd which sent this message, using the supplied delay.
A delay of null will automatically calculate based on the number of attempts and the configured .
Using this method to respond does not trigger a backoff event.

member.param: The minimum amount of time the message will be requeued.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.IMessage.WriteTo(System.IO.Stream)

summary.para: Encodes the message frame and body and writes it to the supplied .
It is suggested that the target is buffered to avoid performing many system calls.

member.exception: Thrown when is null.
member.param: The stream to write this message.
member.returns: The number of bytes written to .

member.name: T:NsqSharp.Config
member.summary:
Config is a struct of NSQ options
The only valid way to create a Config is via NewConfig, using a struct literal will panic. After Config is passed into a high-level type (like Consumer, Producer, etc.) the values are no longer mutable (they are copied).
Use Set(string option, object value) as an alternate way to set parameters

member.name: M:NsqSharp.Config.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of Config.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.Config.Set(System.String,System.Object)

summary.para: Takes an as a string and a and attempts to set the appropriate configuration option.
It attempts to coerce the into the right format depending on the named option and the underlying type of the value passed in.

Calls to that take a as an argument can be input as:
"1000ms" (a string parsed by )
1000 (an integer interpreted as milliseconds)
(1000) (a literal value)

Calls to that take bool can be input as:
"true" (a string parsed by )
true (a boolean)
1 (an int where 1 == true and 0 == false)

exception.para: Thrown when an invalid name is specified.
Thrown when an invalid is specified for the given .

member.param: The option name. See the on properties for valid option names.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.Config.Validate
member.summary: Checks that all config values are within specified min/max ranges.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.Config.Clone
member.summary: Clones (makes a copy) of this instance.
member.returns: A copy of this object.

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.DialTimeout
member.summary: Deadline for establishing TCP connections. Default: 1s

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.ReadTimeout
member.summary: Deadline for network reads. Range: 100ms-5m Default: 60s

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.WriteTimeout
member.summary: Deadline for network writes. Range: 100ms-5m Default: 10s

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.LookupdPollInterval
member.summary: Duration between polling lookupd for new producers. NOTE: when not using nsqlookupd, LookupdPollInterval represents the duration of time between reconnection attempts. Range: 10ms-5m Default: 60s

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.LookupdPollJitter
member.summary: Fractional jitter to add to the lookupd pool loop. This helps evenly distribute requests even if multiple consumers restart at the same time. Range: 0-1 Default: 0.3

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.MaxRequeueDelay
member.summary: Maximum duration when REQueueing (for doubling of deferred requeue). Does not limit of manual requeue delays. Range: 0-60m Default: 15m

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.DefaultRequeueDelay
member.summary: Default requeue delay. Requeue calculation: * . Range: 0-60m Default: 90s

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.BackoffStrategy
member.summary: Backoff strategy, defaults to . Overwrite this to define alternative backoff algorithms. See also . Supported opt values: 'exponential', 'full_jitter'.

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.MaxBackoffDuration
member.summary: Maximum amount of time to backoff when processing fails. Range: 0-60m Default: 2m

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.BackoffMultiplier
member.summary: Unit of time for calculating consumer backoff. Default backoff calculation: * (2 ^ backoff counter). Will not exceed . See: Range: 0-60m Default: 1s

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.MaxAttempts
member.summary: Maximum number of times this consumer will attempt to process a message before giving up. Range: 0-65535 Default: 5

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.LowRdyIdleTimeout
member.summary: Duration to wait for a message from a producer when in a state where RDY counts are re-distributed (ie. max_in_flight < num_producers). Range: 1s-5m Default: 10s

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.RDYRedistributeInterval
member.summary: Duration between redistributing max-in-flight to connections. Range: 1ms-5s Default: 5s

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.RDYRedistributeOnIdle
member.summary: Redistribute RDY counts to active nsqd instances when others are idle. Default: false

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.ClientID
member.summary: ClientID identifier sent to nsqd representing this client. Default: short hostname.

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.Hostname
member.summary: Hostname identifier sent to nsqd representing this client.

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.UserAgent
member.summary: UserAgent identifier sent to nsqd representing this client, in the spirit of HTTP Default: NsqSharp/[version].

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.HeartbeatInterval
member.summary: Duration of time between heartbeats. This must be less than . Default: 30s

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.SampleRate
member.summary: Receive a percentage of messages to sample the channel (requires nsqd 0.2.25+). See: https://github.com/bitly/nsq/pull/223 for discussion. Range: 0-99 Default: 0 (disabled, receive all messages)

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.TlsConfig
member.summary: TLS configuration. Required to use TLS.

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.Deflate
member.summary: Use Deflate compression

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.DeflateLevel
member.summary: Deflate compression level (1-9, default: 6)

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.Snappy
member.summary: Use Snappy compression

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.OutputBufferSize
member.summary: Size of the buffer (in bytes) used by nsqd for buffering writes to this connection. Default: 16384

summary.para: Timeout used by nsqd before flushing buffered writes (set to 0 to disable). Default: 250ms
WARNING: configuring clients with an extremely low (< 25ms) output_buffer_timeout has a significant effect on nsqd CPU usage (particularly with > 50 clients connected).

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.MaxInFlight
member.summary: Maximum number of messages to allow in flight (concurrency knob). Min: 0 Default: 1

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.MessageTimeout
member.summary: The duration the server waits before auto-requeing a message sent to this client. Default = Use server settings (server default = 60s).

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Config.AuthSecret
member.summary: Secret for nsqd authentication (requires nsqd 0.2.29+). See: https://github.com/bitly/nsq/pull/356, https://github.com/jehiah/nsqauth-contrib.

summary.para: Producer is a high-level type to publish to NSQ.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.Utils.Net.Dial(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Dial connects to the address on the named network.
Known networks are "tcp" only at this time.
Addresses have the form host:port. If host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets as in "[::1]:80" or "[ipv6-host%zone]:80". The functions JoinHostPort and SplitHostPort manipulate addresses in this form.

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Utils.TlsConfig.InsecureSkipVerify
member.summary:
InsecureSkipVerify controls whether a client verifies the server's certificate chain and host name. If InsecureSkipVerify is true, TLS accepts any certificate presented by the server and any host name in that certificate. In this mode, TLS is susceptible to man-in-the-middle attacks. This should be used only for testing.
Overrides .

member.name: P:NsqSharp.Utils.TlsConfig.CheckCertificateRevocation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to check certificate revocation (default = true).
member.value: true if certificate revocation should be checked, false if not.

member.name: T:NsqSharp.Utils.WaitGroup
member.summary: A WaitGroup waits for a collection of routines to finish. The main routine calls Add to set the number of routines to wait for. Then each of the routines runs and calls Done when finished. At the same time, Wait can be used to block until all routines have finished. See: http://golang.org/pkg/sync/#WaitGroup

member.name: M:NsqSharp.Utils.WaitGroup.Add(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Add adds delta, which may be negative, to the WaitGroup counter. If the counter becomes zero, all goroutines blocked on Wait are released. If the counter goes negative, Add panics.
Note that calls with a positive delta that occur when the counter is zero must happen before a Wait. Calls with a negative delta, or calls with a positive delta that start when the counter is greater than zero, may happen at any time. Typically this means the calls to Add should execute before the statement creating the routine or other event to be waited for.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.Utils.WaitGroup.Done
member.summary: Done decrements the WaitGroup counter.

member.name: M:NsqSharp.Utils.WaitGroup.Wait
member.summary: Wait blocks until the WaitGroup counter is zero.
